instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
threads.message: Hi guys i managed to get one of these in my store water damaged. Of course upon inspection the water damage was near and around the <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> which is our same as older models tps chip. Checking around  that area i noticed that 5vs5 is missing so i checked for shorts none are present. I checked for my <SIGNAL>PP5VXX_EN</SIGNAL> this signal is missing, which comes from <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P5VS5</SIGNAL>. This signal comes from <CHIP>U7890</CHIP> that seems to be a logic gate, so on the <CHIP>U7890</CHIP> i'm missing <SIGNAL>PMIC_EN_P3V3S5</SIGNAL> that comes from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> the aka PMIC chip which is a bga. So my question is this shit has many input signals. is it possible that something else is not allowing this chip to output the 3v3s5 signal? I'm totally lost on this crap.

threads.title: Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
threads.message: Yes duke they are present that was the first rails I checked

threads.title: Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
threads.message: <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> getting 3V3 and outputting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL>? If END is high then it should output PGD which is the one you are missing.

threads.title: Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
threads.message: on <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> im missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL> is present. END is high but like I said PGD is still missing so i checked PGD for a short to ground and its shorted. Under my Flir gun, the chip is the only thing that is warm on the board.

threads.title: Macbook pro no touchbar 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power On
threads.message: Seems like a dead <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> then. Remove <RESISTOR>R7883</RESISTOR> and see if the short is on the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> side.
